Django (Jamie Foxx) is a freed slave whose brutal past with their former owners takes you to meet the German bounty hunter Dr. King Schultz (Christoph Waltz). Schultz is in search of the killers Brittle brothers, and only Django can take it to them. The unorthodox Schultz bought Django with a promise to release it when you have captured the Brittle brothers, alive or dead.

To carry out his plan, Schultz frees Django, though the two men decide to continue together. This time, Schultz seeks the most dangerous criminals in the southern United States with the help of Django. With a remarkable talent hunter, Django's main objective is to find and rescue Broomhilda (Kerry Washington), his wife, who he has not seen since she was acquired by other owners, many years ago.

The search for Django and Schultz leads them to Calvin Candie (Leonardo DiCaprio), the owner of "Candyland," a plantation famous for coach Ace Woody, who trains slaves to fight local. By exploring the site with false identities, Django and Schultz call the attention of Stephen (Samuel L. Jackson), the trusted slave Candie. The movements of the two start to be drawn, and soon a dangerous organization closes the siege around both. For Django and Schultz get away with Broomhilda, they will have to choose between independence and solidarity, sacrifice and survival.
